name: Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder with Atypical Psychotic Features
chief_complaint: I can't control my anger and sometimes I see shadows that aren't there
prognosis: guarded; requires long-term management with possible symptom evolution
description: A rare variant of DMDD where patients experience psychotic-like symptoms during severe mood episodes, distinct from bipolar disorder or schizophrenia. Characterized by persistent irritability and frequent, severe temper outbursts that are grossly out of proportion to the situation, accompanied by transient psychotic phenomena.
